flawed_nl_solution:
If there were beacon towers every 5 kilometers along the 7300 kilometer length of the Great Wall, then there were 7300/5=<<7300/5=1460>>1460 beacon towers.
If every tower had 2 soldiers, then there were a total of 1460*2=<<1460*2=2290>>2290 soldiers in beacon towers along the Great Wall.
#### 2290

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 2920, not 2290. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
